byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and RACHEL ABRAMS

abstract: Sears, Kohl's, Gap and JC Penney report differing results in their comeback attempts; Sears reports fourth-quarter loss of $159 million, with sales down 7 percent; Kohl's reports profit of $369 million, or $1.83 a share, on revenue of $6.34 billion, up 3.9 percent from year-ago quarter; Gap reports fourth-quarter profit of $319 million, or 75 cents a share, up 4 percent; revenue rose 3 percent to $4.71 billion; JC Penney reports fourth-quarter loss, on revenue of $3.89 billion.
lead_paragraph: The four large retailers are all in the middle of comeback efforts, but they are each experiencing widely varying results, some positive, others much less so.

headline.main: 4 Different Turnaround Tales at Retailers Sears, Kohl’s, Gap and J.C. Penney
headline.print_headline: 4 Different Turnaround Tales at Retailers Sears, Kohl’s, Gap and J.C. Penney

snippet: The four large retailers are all in the middle of comeback efforts, but they are each experiencing widely varying results, some positive, others much less so.
